page.title: 15LIFE STYLES OF THE 1980's
page.content: LIFE STYLES ARE CHANGING. ATTITUDES TO MARRIAGE, PARENTHOOD, FAMILY MEALS ARE VERY DIFFERENT BETWEEN THOSE IN THEIR 30'S AND 60'S. THE OLD CORNISH PATTERN OF MEALTIMES WAS COOKED BREAKFAST,CRIB(ELEVENSES), A COOKED MIDDAY MEAL, TEA AND SUPPER, ALL, EXCEPT CRIB, EATEN COMMUNALLY. NOW EVEN THE CORNISH EAT LESS OFTEN, AND ARE MORE FLEXIBLE IN THEIR MEAL TIMES. THOSE FROM UP COUNTRY (THE ENGLISH) TEND TO LESS COMMUNAL EATING ALTHOUGH MANY STILL HAVE AN EVENING MEAL TOGETHER. DIET HAS ALSO CHANGED. THE LOCAL BUTCHER REPORTS A SHIFT EITHER TO FASTER FOOD OR TO A LESS MEAT ORIENTED DIET. THE OLDER INHABITANTS CLAIM TO MORE CONSERVATIVE IN FOOD THAN THE YOUNGER. BAKING IS STILL A SKILL VALUED HIGHLY.
